intro: Lappula bella, commonly known as the beautiful lappula, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pink or reddish, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Lappula bella is often found in open habitats such as tundra, meadows, and mountain slopes.
